body.para: I am concerned about IOP. I am unfamiliar with sync4J concepts.
Does what you expose handle the case when the sync4J server is talking to a non-sync4j client? How does anyone know that the OPAQUE data is CDATA?
body.footer: Gatespace Telematics Första Långgatan 18 41328 Göteborg Sweden Phone: +46 702 04 35 11 Fax: +46 31 24 16 50 Email: philippe.laporte@gatespacetelematics.com

quote.quotepara: Hi, This is a question about interoperability of WBXML implementations when it comes to CDATA encoding.
I have used the tools available from the libwbxml project.
It appears that CDATAs are encoded into OPAQUE.
I couldn't find the section in the WBXML specification document that specifies this.
Is it specified at all, or is it in any way standardized to do this? The complementary question is what is the heuristics for knowing what's in an OPAQUE section?
I am not aware that the data of the items is defined in the SyncML protocol/WBXML. The data in the items might be anything. Therefore, also CDATA encoding.

You have two options with respect to handling the data in the items, I guess. 1) have a syncsource for a specific format only. 2) have a generic syncsource that can detect the format. Only in the last case it is useful for the server to have the ability to detect the format, since in the first one it is set by client configuration (mostly performed by a human).
